intro: Phyteuma longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, often with a silvery underside, contributing to its ornamental value. Phyteuma longifolium is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and long blooming period.
